title: Gender roles for women in Christianity and Islam, when taught from childhood, constitute grooming.

author: AnthemWasHeard
text:
>For example in a marriage any time there is a disagreement the husband gets the final say.

No, that is just not how it works. I'm sorry if you're one of those people who was raised in a denomination constituting about 0.05% of the "Christian" population who practices patriarchal purity culture, but your average Christian married couple treats decisions the same as everybody else. I.e., when husband and wife disagree, the *wife* is always right.

>Both religions say it’s sinful to turn down your partner for sex. Now I know this flows both ways, but with men on average having much higher sex drives it obviously is to the male’s advantage.

Slightly... maybe? Assuming that's an "advantage" as the word typically connotates.

[https://www.bustle.com/articles/109705-women-want-sex-just-as-much-as-men-do-new-survey-shows-and-more-things-to#:\~:text=Over%20Half%20Of%20Women%20Want%20More%20Sex&text=Of%20those%20surveyed%2C%2053.2%20percent,having%20their%20sexual%20desires%20fulfilled](https://www.bustle.com/articles/109705-women-want-sex-just-as-much-as-men-do-new-survey-shows-and-more-things-to#:~:text=Over%20Half%20Of%20Women%20Want%20More%20Sex&text=Of%20those%20surveyed%2C%2053.2%20percent,having%20their%20sexual%20desires%20fulfilled).

To summarize, half of women want the frequency of their sex to be greater. So again, even if having lots of sex is some sort of a competitive advantage, it's one that ***plenty*** of women should utilize, too.

>you might emphasize the obligations of husbands, but a sex slave that is treated better than most sex slaves is still a sex slave.

Firstly, they're both sex-slaves, as you've already pointed out.

Secondly, please do not compare married adult women who would have no relationship other than their present one to kidnaped children who're sold and raped on the daily in third world countries, people who are *actual* sex slaves.

Speaking of, let's check out these obligations of husbands. This is from Ephesians 5:

>Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for it, that He might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word, and that He might present to Himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing, but that it should be holy and without blemish. In this way men ought to love their wives as their own bodies.

The word "love" here, in the original Greek, is *agape*. The Greeks had numerous words for *love*, and *agape* means *sacrificial* love, as this passage indicates. Paul says to love your wives like Jesus loves us, and Jesus loves us enough to die for us.

Here's what that looks like: my father, who has no interest whatsoever in anything to do with horses, which he shouldn't because horses are a terrible investment that turn beautiful land into stinky mudholes, for the sake of my country, horse-loving mother, dedicated half of our property into a pasture for the horses, built all one-thousand feet of the fence to enclose it, and build *two* barns. When she wanted a new kitchen table but didn't want to pay for a new one, my father built one for her (I had to help, and trust me, if you haven't build one then you don't understand the difficulty of the task). When she wants new shelves, he builds them. When she wants a room painted, he paints it.

"bUt SeX sLaV-" I'm sorry, but who looks like they're getting more out of this relationship? Is my mother an oppressed sex slave who has no autonomy and no means of disseminating her desires unless it's something that my father would also enjoy?

>The most fair solution I can think of is either close monitoring of all religious households to make sure daughters are always aware of all their options and potential removal from the home always being on the table, or making it illegal to teach children about religion.

This is why America exists to begin with. People fled from England to live in absence of a government controlling them on the basis of religious beliefs that the government didn't approve of. What do you think the gun-totting right is going to do if our government starts to discriminate against Christians? Even the non-Christian ones are going to go up in arms.

>I realize neither of these solutions are feasible or likely, but I don’t see any other way for women and girls to be protected in these cultures.

They do not need protection from religion. They aren't attacked or oppressed by religion. Not even the typical Muslim marriage in America resembles anything in the ball park of your nonsensical fear-mongering.

Its this kind of propaganda that makes me worried from the future. What if someone like you gets enough power to start discriminating against religious people, regulating their households and raising their kids for them. I guess you're one of those who thinks that Florida schools should be able to take the place of Floridian parents, even though the bill preventing this is based on a school abusing a child with gender ideology to the point that she tried to commit suicide multiple times on the school's grounds before they contacted her parents about her gender confusion?

The fact that this sort of bigoted dictatorial Orwellian nonsense is propagated should alarm anybody with more braincells than Biden has years left to live and is why we cling to our guns. Thank goodness my sisters and I were InDoCrInAtEd into proficient firearms use.

author: AnthemWasHeard
text:
>I'd say modern relationships shy away from what is considered "good" in the bible.

And how is the relationship between my parents unbefitting, given the meaning of the word *agape* which Paul expounds upon as saying, "Husbands, love (<- agape) your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself for it," which means, "Love your wives so much that you'll die on a cross for them"? I think my father's properly interpreting that passage.

>The man has the final say. Yes we are supposed to respect our wives but we are in charge.

This contradicts the notion of *sacrificial love,* the meaning of *agape*. You are supposed to love your wife so much that you will undergo significant sacrifices for her, crucifixion-like sacrifices if necessary. No, we're not "in charge," of our wives as if they were a hired housemaid or our children.

Again, mother wants a square acre of fence and two barns for horses? You tell me, if my father was in charge of my mother, if she lacked agency or authority as to decisions of how our their property was used, when why did my father do exactly what she wanted in complete contradiction to what he wanted?

>Define "persecution"

No, because I've no idea who you're quoting, and therefore also have no idea of the context in which the word was used.
